greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Dirichlet convolution of n and tau^2(n).
comment: Dirichlet convolution of A000027 and A035116.
Inverse Mobius transform of A060724. - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 15 2011
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
formula: a(n) = Sum_{i|n, j|n} sigma(i)*sigma(j)/sigma(lcm(i,j)), where sigma(n) = sum of divisors of n.
a(n) = Sum_{d|n} d*tau(n/d)^2, where tau(n) = number of divisors of n.
G.f.: Sum_{k>=1} tau(k)^2*x^k/(1 - x^k)^2. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Nov 02 2018
Sum_{k=1..n} a(k) ~ 5 * Pi^4 * n^2 / 144. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 28 2019
a(n) = Sum_{d|n} tau(d^2)*sigma(n/d), where tau(n) = number of divisors of n, and sigma(n) = sum of divisors of n. - _Ridouane Oudra_, Aug 25 2019
mathematica: a[n_] := Sum[ DivisorSigma[1, i]*DivisorSigma[1, j] / DivisorSigma[1, LCM[i, j]], {i, Divisors[n]}, {j, Divisors[n]}]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 60}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 26 2013 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = sumdiv(n, d, d*numdiv(n/d)^2); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 03 2018
(MAGMA) [&+[d*#Divisors(Floor(n/d))^2:d in Divisors(n)]:n in [1..60]]; // _Marius A. Burtea_, Aug 25 2019
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jul 07 2001
